title: Public transport for the NRL Round 10 –  Melbourne Storm v Wests Tigers
articleContent:
The NRL Season continues as Melbourne Storm hosts the Wests Tigers on Mother’s Day, Sunday 11 May.

Public transport is your best way to enjoy the action and we're running extra services to help you get home from AAMI Park.

Kick-off is at 2pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Note: 

  • Cranbourne and Pakenham lines - passengers change at Caulfield station for services to the city
  • Belgrave and Lilydale lines - buses replace trains between Blackburn, Belgrave and Lilydale
  • Sunbury Line - buses replace trains between North Melbourne and Sunshine stations
  • Werribee Line - buses replace trains between Newport and Werribee

 Metropolitan train

Return trains from Richmond Station

  • Glen Waverley - leaving at 4:06pm from Platform 10
  • Sandringham - leaving at 4:14pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Catch a Route 70 tram between Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Melbourne Showgrounds

Catch a Route 246 bus close to AAMI Park.

 Regional train

Normal trains leave from Southern Cross Station.
